transcript: the Russian troops had halted and after a fight had not on- ly held the field but had repulsed the French. Though the troops were ill-clad, exhausted, and had lost a third of their number in killed, wounded, sick, and stragglers; though a num- ber of sick and wounded had been abandoned on the other side of the Danube with a letter in which Kutuzov entrusted them to the hu- manity of the enemy; and though the big hos- pitals and the houses in Krems converted into military hospitals could
